entry.title: Serializing Data with Google's Protocol Buffers
entry.summary:
Description

This talk is an introduction to Google's protocol buffers (aka protobuf). Protocol buffers are a language-neutral, platform-neutral, extensible mechanism for serializing structured data â€“ think XML, but smaller, faster, and simpler. This talk will include a demonstration of using protobuf with Python to communicate with an embedded, processing- and memory-restricted device.
